author: Hadlee Simons
title: Vox explains ADSL outage
text:
Vox explains ADSL outage Tue, 13 Oct 2015 7:48 PM Share Credit: sxc.hu 
Popular ISP Vox Telecom has revealed the cause of an ADSL outage this week. 
The company said that the outage earlier this week was due to a power supply interruption at its Waverley data centre. 
"Our technicians and technical team have worked through the night to restore affected services, in an effort to minimise further downtime," said Shane Chorley, executive head of Carrier and Connectivity at Vox. 
The company has been slowly restoring service to customers, but thanked the remaining users still affected by the outage. 
Updates to customers will continue to be provided through social media and via text message and email, Vox continued. 
"We'd like to thank our loyal customers for their continued understanding and support as we work to get all of our services back online," concluded Chorley. Read More
